monasteries.name: Rumtek Monastery
description: Karma Kagyu sect monastery built as Karmapa’s seat in exile
Originally founded in the 12th century; reconstructed by the 16th Gyalwa Karmapa in the 1960s
Houses the Golden Stupa containing the 16th Karmapa’s remains
Located ~24 km from Gangtok in a forested valley
monasteries.history: Originally built in the 12th century; present complex established by the 16th Karmapa (1960s)

monasteries.name: Enchey Monastery
description: Built in 1909 (rebuilt 1948 after a fire)
Belongs to the Nyingma tradition; originally founded ~200 years ago
Dedicated to Buddha, Avalokiteshvara and Guru Padmasambhava
Famous for colorful Cham dance festival
Perched on a hill (3 km from Gangtok) with views of Kanchenjunga
monasteries.history: Built in 1909 and rebuilt in 1948 after a fire

monasteries.name: Phodong Monastery
description: Constructed in 1740 by the 4th Chogyal Gyurmed Namgyal
Affiliated to the Karma Kagyu lineage; one of six major monasteries of Sikkim
Houses ~260 monks and is famous for its murals
Annual Cham dance festival held in Dec/Jan

monasteries.name: Dubdi Monastery
description: Founded in 1701 by Lhatsun Namkha Jigme (Hermit’s Cell)
Oldest monastery in Sikkim; follows the Nyingma tradition
Contains statues of the founding lamas and rare manuscripts
Part of Yuksom’s Buddhist pilgrimage circuit

monasteries.name: Gonjang Monastery
description: Established in 1981 by Tingkye Gonjang Rinpoche (Nyingma)
Altitude ~6066 ft; located ~7–8 km from Gangtok
Contains idols of Khen-lop-Choe-sum and other unique Tibetan relics
Blessed by the Dalai Lama; home to ~100 monks
monasteries.history: Founded in 1981; blessed by the Dalai Lama

monasteries.name: Samdruptse Monastery
description: Features a 45 m golden statue of Guru Padmasambhava (Second Buddha)
Name means 'Wish-Fulfilling Hill'; statue inaugurated in 2004
Important pilgrimage site with meditation hall and landscaped gardens
Perched on a hilltop offering panoramic views of Kanchenjunga
monasteries.history: Completed in 2004; houses the Samdruptse statue of Guru Padmasambhava

monasteries.name: Tashiding Monastery
description: Founded 1641 by Ngadak Sempa Chempo Phunshok Rigzin (Nyingma)
Name means 'Devoted Central Glory'; among the holiest in Sikkim
Perched on a 5000 ft hilltop between the Rathong and Rangeet rivers
Hosts the annual Bumchu (holy water) festival (Tibetan new year)
monasteries.history: Established 1641; famed for the Bumchu holy-water vase ceremony

monasteries.name: Ralang Monastery
description: Founded 1768; Kagyu sect monastery near Ravangla
Known for the Pang Lhabsol festival (honoring Kanchenjunga) in September
Renowned for extensive Tibetan Buddhist thangka paintings
Hosts colorful Cham dance festivals (e.g. Mahakala festival)
monasteries.history: Established 1768 by the 12th Gyaltsab Rinpoche (Kagyu sect); rebuilt in 1995

monasteries.name: Labrang Monastery
description: Built 1843–1844 by Gyalshe Rigzing Chempa (son of King Tsugphud Namgyal)
Nyingma sect; located 2 km above Phodong Monastery
Unique wooden structure (reinforced after 2006 quake)
Houses a museum of ancient Buddha statues, sutras and murals
monasteries.history: Founded 1844 by Gyalshe Rigzing Chempa (Nyingma); renovated in 1978:contentReference[oaicite:67]{index=67}

monasteries.name: Pemayangtse Monastery
description: Founded 1705 by Lama Lhatsun Chempo (expanded by Chogyal Chakdor Namgyal)
One of Sikkim’s oldest monasteries (Nyingma); main seat of the Nyingma lineage
Perched at 2100 m overlooking the ancient Rabdentse ruins
Famous for the annual Cham dance festival (Tibetan New Year, Feb)
monasteries.history: Established 1705 by Lhatsun Chempo; royal family temple for Nyingma sect

monasteries.name: Sanghak Monastery
description: Built 1697 by Lama Lhatsun Chempo; Nyingma tradition
Second oldest monastery in Sikkim ('Place of Secret Mantras')
Preserves ancient clay statues and relics from the 17th century
Perched on a ridge with views of the Himalayas and Pemayangtse
monasteries.history: Founded 1697 by Lhatsun Chempo (Nyingma sect); contains precious relics

monasteries.name: Lingdim Monastery
description: Also known as Ranka Monastery; inaugurated 1999 by Zurmang Gharwang Rinpoche
Zurmang Kagyud tradition; Tibetan-style complex set over 21 acres
Hosts a 5 m golden Buddha and a large collection of thangka paintings
Scenic hillside location near Ranka (~16 km from Gangtok)
monasteries.history: Built in 1999 by the Zurmang Gharwang Rinpoche (Kagyu sect)
